SEARCH
Package nz.ac.wgtn.swen225.lc.render

Class WinLoseImplement

java.lang.Object
nz.ac.wgtn.swen225.lc.render.WinLoseImplement
public class WinLoseImplement extends Object
responsible for handling the display of win/lose messages and playing corresponding sound effects when the player either wins or loses the game. It tracks whether the win/lose music has already been played to avoid repetition.

  • Method Details

    • drawWinLose

      public void drawWinLose(GameState gameState, Graphics g, JPanel jpanel)
      Draws the win or lose message on the game screen
      Parameters:
      gameState - the current state of the game.
      g - the Graphics object used to draw the message.
      jpanel - the JPanel where the message will be drawn.

    • playMusic

      public static void playMusic(String name)
      Plays the music based on the provided sound file name.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the sound file to play, without the file extension.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the music file cannot be found or played.

    • allMusicPlayed

      public static void allMusicPlayed(GameState gameState)
      Plays the appropriate music based on the player's state (win or lose). It ensures that the win or lose music is only played once during the relevant event. Also, resets the win/lose flags when the game continues without a win or loss.
      Parameters:
      gameState - the current state of the game.

    • mute

      public static void mute(boolean mute)
      mute and unmute the win/lose music
      Parameters:
      mute - to decide whether mute the win/lose music
